result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin A. Czerwinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin A. Czerwinski appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:51 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court reviews the letter from DOC requesting clarification of the JOC. 
Defendant makes statements.  
Atty Drengler indicates he spoke to the defendant. 
Court questions if the defendant consents to appearing by telephone. 
Defendant consents to this telephone appearance. 
Atty Constable makes statements.  Parties have come to an agreement that the probation should be run concurrent to his entire sentence. 
Atty Drengler concurs. 

BY THE COURT:  The 36 months probation is to run concurrent with any other sentence he is currently serving.  Clerk to amend the JOC and sent to DOC. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin A. Czerwinski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Marvin A. Czerwinski in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:10 a.m. Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated. Questions concurrent/consecutive.
Atty Constable clarifies. 
Court questions Atty Constable. 
Atty Drengler indicates defendant is scheduled to be released from prison on 6/15/15.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
42 months in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 24 months Initial Confinement followed by 18 months Extended Supervision STAYED:
46 days credit.
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, consecutive to the confinement portion of sentence he is presently serving.
Not to have any contact, direct/indirect, with Kasie Roberts.
Pay costs.  DNA surcharge not required. 
Provide a DNA sample if it is not already in the databank. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse programs.

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on April 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marvin A. Czerwinski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Marvin A. Czerwinski in custody.  Elizabeth A. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:04 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.  
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial in Branch 3. 

ARRAIGNMENT
Court has received an Information from the ADA.  Waives reading of the Information.  
Defendant and his attorney has received the same and enters a NG plea.  Court accepts the plea.

Bond Continued 

3:07 p.m. case is concluded  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
No contact, direct or indirect, with Kasie Roberts.

Defendant Marvin A. Czerwinski appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:01 p.m. Court calls the case. 

Court reviews the file.  

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Cousins recommends a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
